heading: Program Outcomes, Program Educational Objectives & Program Specific Outcomes
description: Comprehensive framework defining the educational goals, expected competencies, and specialized outcomes for B.Tech Computer Science Engineering graduates.

sections.title: Program Outcomes (POs)
sections.description: Program Outcomes define what students are expected to know and be able to do by the time of graduation.

items.title: Engineering Knowledge
items.description: Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals, and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex engineering problems.

items.title: Problem Analysis
items.description: Identify, formulate, review research literature, and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using first principles of mathematics, natural sciences, and engineering sciences.

items.title: Design/Development of Solutions
items.description: Design solutions for complex engineering problems and design system components or processes that meet the specified needs with appropriate consideration for the public health and safety, and the cultural, societal, and environmental considerations.

items.title: Conduct Investigations of Complex Problems
items.description: Use research-based knowledge and research methods including design of experiments, analysis and interpretation of data, and synthesis of the information to provide valid conclusions.

items.title: Modern Tool Usage
items.description: Create, select, and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modern engineering and IT tools including prediction and modeling to complex engineering activities with an understanding of the limitations.

items.title: The Engineer and Society
items.description: Apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assess societal, health, safety, legal and cultural issues and the consequent responsibilities relevant to the professional engineering practice.

items.title: Environment and Sustainability
items.description: Understand the impact of the professional engineering solutions in societal and environmental contexts, and demonstrate the knowledge of, and need for sustainable development.

items.title: Ethics
items.description: Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of the engineering practice.

items.title: Individual and Team Work
items.description: Function effectively as an individual, and as a member or leader in diverse teams, and in multidisciplinary settings.

items.title: Communication
items.description: Communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineering community and with society at large, such as, being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation, make effective presentations, and give and receive clear instructions.

items.title: Project Management and Finance
items.description: Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering and management principles and apply these to one's own work, as a member and leader in a team, to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments.

items.title: Life-long Learning
items.description: Recognize the need for, and have the preparation and ability to engage in independent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological change.

sections.title: Program Specific Outcomes (PSOs)
sections.description: Program Specific Outcomes articulate what students should be able to do specifically in Computer Science Engineering.

items.title: Web-based Technology Implementation
items.description: Analyze and implement Web-based technology for developing projects as per social and Industry needs.

items.title: Open-source Development
items.description: Ability to develop various applications using open-source software tools extensively.

sections.title: Program Educational Objectives (PEOs)
sections.description: Program Educational Objectives define the expected accomplishments of graduates during the first few years after graduation.

items.title: Professional Employment & Entrepreneurship
items.description: Graduates will have the ability to be employed in industries, academia, the public sector, or work as entrepreneurs.

items.title: Innovation & Research
items.description: Graduates will apply tools, technologies, and research to provide innovative solutions.

items.title: Problem Solving
items.description: Graduates will have capabilities in identifying, conceptualizing, designing, developing, and implementing logical solutions for real-life challenges.

items.title: Professional Skills
items.description: Graduates will have good communication skills, leadership skills, ethical values, and time management.
